intro: Psychotria heterocarpa, commonly known as the "Amazonian Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny, black seeds. Psychotria heterocarpa is often found in dense undergrowth and is adapted to the high humidity and warm climate of its native habitat.
